Ok, the name is misleading.  Genuinely the worst falafel I have ever had.  Not fresh (not fried to order) greasy, yet bone dry falafel balls.  Hummus was good, pickled veg was good...but it did not come with any white tahini or tzatziki  type sauce at all, which could just be the way the do it in Iraq....but with limp dry balls it was badly needed.  Probably my first and last time.  I want fresh food.  More than that I want un-lazy, hot, decent food. I am going to buy an edible lunch now from somewhere that serves today's food.
Its a nice place to have some decent middle Eastern food. I tried the falafel and sandwich, pretty delicious. Best part about them , the price is very reasonable.
Ali Baba Gyros: Rob J.
One of the best gyros I've ever had. Great prices. Good atmosphere. I love hole in the wall places like this.
E G.
Great gyros. some say it's a bit overpriced but you get a lot of food. So you basically get what you pay for. :) The man who helped us (I'm guessing is the owner) is super friendly. :)
Avinash P.
Awesome food and great atmosphere. A must try!
Luke I.

Sorry. Not a fan.  I ordered the falafel and wanted to substitute hummus for the white dairy sauce.  This was not acceptable to the owner, and I had to pay an extra 5.99 for a side of hummus.  The veggies were pale and old.I'll try the other gyro place down the street.  No problem!
Danielle H.
Hole in the wall right near campus, open late and serves the best gyros! Big portion sizes! Friendly service, highly recommend.
Derek S.

The best place for a gyro or chicken kabob in town! The Z- plate is the greatest thing I have ever eaten anywhere. The staff is friendly and they are open late. Don't be fooled by the other ripoff place in town, this is the real deal!
Zac T.

Friendly employees, great food, cozy and nostalgic dining area. If you grew up in Lincoln, maybe just went to college there, I'm sure this place is familiar. Everything on the menu is very good, definitely get a gyro if you can't decide what to eat!
Arnold F.
The gyros are yummy. The place gives off a quint family run atmosphere. Great care goes into each dish. Good food, good people. I would eat here again for sure.
Jon A.
I have certainly had much better gyros before. It was just very average and not worth my 8 dollars again. The Tzatziki sauce was sub par to say the least.
Solomon H.
Always good gyros to have for anytime of the day!  Portion is adequate for the money & the steak fries are good compliment !
Kim R.
Been going to Ali baba's for a decade and a half....it's amazing ...every damn time! !!!! Best steak fries EVER!!!
Teddy W.
Best gyro in town. Little pricey and you definitely gotta ask em to make it good or they will skimp. Awesome after the bars, or even just a switch it up dinner.
KR H.

Reasonable PricesFast serviceGreat quality food and lots of choicesNever had anything I didn't really enjoy.Serving size is generous.This place is a lunch treasure.Better than your average gyro place for sure.
Lilah R.

I have been an Ali baba's fan since I was in high school and extremely picky on what I would even try.  Now any time I can find an excuse to get to downtown it's a sure bet I'm stopping at Ali baba's.  The gyros are massive.  If you're looking for something light to snack on I would try something else.  The gyros are cheap and are more than enough for you to pick at for the day.  The service is always great.  Don't expect anything fancy decor-wise but if you are enjoying the night life down town and are looking for something to end the night, Ali baba's gyros are the way to go.
Lisa S.
Food was delicious, good service, will be back soon to get my favorite Greek food in Lincoln.
Janet L.
I love the gyros and steak fries here! By far, the best gyros in town, and the steak fries are fantastic
Alek Z.

Pretty decent for Americanized Greek food. In fact, they're more deserving of like a 3.5 star rating.I'm on a crusade to try out all the Mediterranean joints in town, so I stopped in here earlier today for lunch. Their menu seemed to have quite a few options, but whenever I try someplace new I always order the standard: gyro and baklava. I was feeling especially hungry so I got the plate with everything on it. I was pleasantly surprised by the succulency (new favorite word) of the meat, that part was good. The sauce was good as well, but there was something a little off about it. Either this was some kind of ranch dressing or it was a style of tzatziki that I'm unfamiliar with. It was pretty tasty, if not possibly somewhat unauthentic. The baklava was also pretty good, so extra points for that. The whole shebang plus drink came out to like $10.39, which seems about average. Overall, I've got no real complaints. A pretty standard but satisfactory joint.
Sarah P.
I love the Z plate. Fills me up every time.
Don M.

We have several places in town to buy greek frood.  Some are fancier, some are stranger, but for a simple gyro sandwich, there is no better place in Lincoln to go.  Large portions of meat and generous sauce is what sets this gyro apart from any place else in Lincoln.   It may not look fancy, but taste is the determining factor isn't it.
Ibrahim A.
Good restaurant and deserve 4 stares.Please try it and you will love it.
Stu F.
Serving college kids. If your expecting decent food try somewhere else. I'm a food critique with over 100 reviews on TA.
Christina H.

I really enjoy Ali Babas. The people who work there are friendly and helpful, and the food is consistently good. The menu is ridiculously extensive. I say ridiculously because there is no reason to get anything other than the cheese gyro. But that's just my opinion. My brother had the falafel and said it was very good as well. Reasonably priced and a great location. The interior is rather boring, but it's got that hole-in-the-wall charm that I think adds to the whole experience. Overall:Service: Always friendly, those guys are great.Food: Consistently good; large menu.Atmosphere: Acceptable. Charmingly acceptable.
Toni A.

Going out to eat is almost like a mating ritual for me and my partner so we tend to go out to eat frequently. When we want a burger, we head over to Ali Baba Gyros. Yes. CHEESEBURGERS. Mushroom Swiss to be exact. It does take extra time as they make your meat patty fresh from frozen but they are nice enough to tell you that it will take extra. It's great that they know people are in a hurry downtown. Open late, you can head in until 2am or so and still order off the menu. I am not a fan of lamb so I don't get gyros, but the burgers are the big draw for me. You get a choice of steak fries or freshly made crinkle cuts. Cheese sticks are delicious and so are the fried mushrooms. We have ordered onion rings but they were undercooked and not delicious so we stick to fries. Ali Baba has a large selection of items; almost too many! But there are some vegetarian options on the menu and they usually make everything fresh to order although some may be frozen. Overall, a good choice for downtown Lincoln any time of day. During the warm months, they have a great outside seating area where you can park your bike, sit, enjoy the weather and people watch.
Sina S.

Gotta try this place! It's a Lincoln staple and has been around forever. I get the same tandoori chicken kabob every time! It's tasty on pita or over salad. I like the portion size and I can save it for later or just save my appetite for this delicious/healthy dish!
King B.

A very friendly staff and a large menu. If you are downtown and are having a Greek craving, stop in. We have been going there for years and love the owner! Vegetarian friendly with some good American choices as well.
Ruth F.

I've been coming here for years, ever since George's Greek Gyro's moved down the street and I realized that, as a vegetarian, there was no longer anything I could get there but a salad on a pita.I kind of like the Greek ranch sauce (I think of it as a tzatziki variant) and the Greek fries are awesome.I usually get the falafel, which I've been happy with.  There's a big menu, carefully chalked in on a big chalkboard above the owner's head.Credit cards OK but it costs extra to use one.The place is a little dinged up (it's been a restaurant, without many changes, for about the last 25 years now; my dad started eating at George's in the early 80s) but that doesn't bother me.  The stupid TV they installed does.  I keep saying I'll stop coming here because of the TV but I still come by occasionally.
Kim J.

I hate to give this place a bad review.  But the food was terrible.  I had to go to Lincoln for a meeting.  I have searched Omaha for a good falafel sandwich but have yet to find one that I consider even mediocre.  As I was driving in, I noticed this place and they had a sign that said "falafel".  On the way back I had to stop. I will say that the guy that served me, that I assume was the owner was wonderful.  He was VERY VERY nice.  I ordered the falafel sandwich with a side of hummus.  They make their own bread which was pretty good but it was a bit thick for me.  When he initially brought me the sandwich, there was no sauce.  I asked for yogurt-tahini sauce.  What I got was some disgusting sauce that was closer to a bad ranch dressing.  I was able to dip the falafel in the hummus, which had alot of poor quality oil, similar to motor oil, on top of it.  The sandwich did come with fries, which were the best part of the meal.  When I initially saw the fries, I thought--oh--i didn't want fries.  But they were good.The owner had a conversation with another customer and told him the most popular thing is the gyro and that is what most people order the first time they were in.  He was impressed that I had ordered the falafel.  I should have told him how bad stuff was but he was so nice.In their case under the cash register, were some delicious looking pastries.   I asked him where they were from because I recognized the boxes from a place that I used to frequent in Dearborn MI.  He was familiar with the place but reported that they made the pastries themselves.  I had to get some, so I ordered two to eat on my drive back.  They too, were a huge disappointment.  I think they were stale and had a rather rancid oil and honey quality to them.  Maybe their gyros are better.....
Jimmy H.
They hook it up on the gyro meat! They are open late which works well for the kids going to Harry Potter's midnight premier or after you get out of the bar (I am the latter).
Quetta L.
OMG!!  The tandoori chicken kabob is the best late night food ever (but you're going to have to wait for it!)Those lemon-y potatoes are so tasty as well.
Salmon P.
Love it! Though I always confuse it with the place next door. What's that one called again? Oh never mind. They're both the best.
Josh S.

I am never disappointed here.  Great people run this place, and the food is fantastic.  I like the Z plate, the chicken kabob, and the burgers.  All very tasty and reasonably priced.  Plus they are open late!
Ben L.

We've been eating at Ali Baba's for years and it's one of our favorite places in Lincoln.  Our go-to meal is the gyro plate, which is a great value for the price.  You get a generous helping of gyro meat piled on their delicious pita bread, covered with onion, tomato and their great tzatziki (not ranch) sauce.  The greek potato fries are fantastic too.  The owner is one of the most friendly and likable people running a restaurant in town.  He's always happy to see us when we drop by.  If you're in Lincoln, it's definitely worth a try.
HK T.
Tried this place on a recommendation from a coworker.  I was pretty disappointed with the Gyros.  Large portion - but the gyro meat was very salty & I couldn't finish my gyro.
J C.
i think the best Gyro hut in Lincoln
King Kong Restaurant: Jacob B.

Get the gyro! I'll just throw that out there first. The restaurant itself has a burger-joint feel but with a gorilla themed twist that is fun. However, King Kongs has some interesting pieces to their menu including a Philly cheese steak and a gyro.I couldn't resist trying the gyro platter, and I was not disappointed. The platter came with crispy fries, a tasty Greek style salad, and a loaded gyro that tastes great. The price was fair and the service was very fast. The parking lot and drink machine could use a little maintenance but I consider those minor problems.If you are looking for good fast food, I would recommend trying King Kongs.
Frosty D.

Hit the drive thru and got a gyro. Don't eat gyros all that often but know good from bad. This one was very good. Would have picked up a burger, but the price indicated it was probably as big as a pizza.  Maybe next time.
Walt G.
The staff was surly, the food was poor and the prices were way too high. I have no idea why this place gets good reviews. It was awful.
Beca H.

I love the chicken gyro! Thats all I will get with the greek potatoes! Love it! I did however receive and unwanted hair in my potatoes one day. I picked it out and kept eating. You get a lot of food for what you pay in my opinion. It's like 5 pounds of food for 10 bucks.
Stephanie V.
Great Gyros, Huge Burgers... Not sure what The King Kong decor has to do with Greek food but overall good place
Joe T.

I have not been in one since my college days.  Visiting friends I decided to stop in here for lunch after visiting the zoo.  It brought back memories of my college days.  They still have the different size burgers depending how hungry you are.  Years removed from college, I ordered the regular King Kong combo.  The food is still as good as I remembered it.   A good place for burger that is better than fast food but does not take to long.
Lisa B.

Love the food and always friendly service!! We will be back. Love love the Greek food. And burgers! Salad...burger and baclava. My boyfriend had a gyro I am going for that next time. Awesomeness! Muy Rico! MUCH I SIMON GRACIAS!
Elena C.

Cool concept and delicious food!! I love the independent vibe, the colorful atmosphere, and the burgers. These guys really have the perfect greasy dank burger meal down. I would compare it as being a step above B-Bops or Burger King in quality, flavor, portions, and atmosphere. I ordered a double but ended up having to take a patty off because it was so large! A problem I never have at BK. Their food is that much more quality and filling than the chains. Good stop on your way to and from Rado! ;)
Jessica B.

I've never been so disgusted and have never given a one star. I went here for the first time and i had a giant burger and fries. The burger was burnt and was nothing special. I could've made it at home. The fries seemed like I could've bought a frozen bag at walmart and sprinkled a whole buncha seasoning on it. It made me feel gross. I'm sorry but I will never come back. Ever! I'm surprised it's still open to be honest. I was just so disappointed /: next time I'll go to Diary Queen across the street.
Ryan M.

Though I know a lot of people like it, this place has never impressed me with their food.  There are places in Lincoln to get better versions of each menu item at around the same price.So what does that leave?  Convenience?  I suppose if you're traveling along I-80 and need to stop for gas and a meal, that might be the case.  But as others have pointed out, there's no point in trying to eat this stuff in a car, so you'll want to actually go in.You'll get plenty of food with an order, that's not an issue here.  The place is reasonably clean, quick with service (drive thru also moves along fine), and the portions are large.  I'm just not a fan of what actually makes up the meals.Over the handful of times I've tried them, I've found the food bland, overly greasy, and having what little flavors remain muddled and run together.  It just smacks of poorly done everything, at least regarding the food.  Even the gyros are only average, if that, and consistently reward me with an unhappy stomach.Now, before the management change a number of years back, the service here was awful.  So bad that I refused to ever go again.  When the management changed, I gave them another chance and can happily say things in that area have vastly improved.But the food hasn't gotten any better.  I tend to try them every six months or so, for some unknown reason, and am always disappointed no matter what I end up getting.  This last time was probably my final attempt.  There are just too many options within a reasonable distance that can offer a better, similarly priced version of something on their menu.
Heidi J.

King Kong promises a fun atmosphere for the whole family. The food portions are humongous , so make sure you go with an appetite. The place was clean and the staff were friendly. It was also very easy to find.
Derek B.

Went here a LONG time ago and ordered a burger, WAS NOT impressed as meat seemed very dry.  However, I gave it a chance about a month ago and came back twice.IMO, come here for the Greek food, meaning Gyro's, Greek Salads and Greek Potatoes.  You don't go to a Greek place for a cheap steak or an overpriced burger.  If you stick with the Gyro's you should be fine.  One of the other posters said they didn't think it was the best Gyro in Lincoln or that the portion size was that big.  However, I have to disagree.  I have been to Ali-Baba's downtown and I think Kong's is better both in taste and in size.  I haven't been to the Partheon yet, but, plan to do so as I have heard good things.  The two times I've had Gyro's here, they have been very good sized (I'm sure it does matter who's making the Gyro's that particular time as far as portion size.)  Once I had the Gyro platter and I was stuffed.  The Greek salad and Greek potatoes were VERY good as well.  I asked if they sold their Greek dressing, unfortunately the answer was "No."  The dressing is that good.  Also, I think the flavor of the meat is some of the best I've had in Nebraska.  If it weren't for my bad experience with the Burger, I would probably give this place 5 stars.  Also, a tip:  If you like your food HOT, be careful when asking for your Gyro HOT.  I did, the dry rub was very good, but, EXTREMELY HOT.  I almost couldn't eat it except for drenching it in extra Tzaziki sauce.  So, I'd ask for the hot rub on the side.
Joe M.
One of the best gyros I've had. Great fries. The burgers are good too, and huge! I made the mistake of ordering the double cheeseburger... I couldn't finish it, but I love leftovers!
James G.

It was late, and we were road weary.  Stayed at the hotel right next to this place, and walked over.  It had "this can't be good" written all over it, but it was different, decorated with gorillas outside and in.  There were only two other people in the place, and four employees.  They sell burgers and gyros and the portions are enormous.  The meat hanging on the gyro thing looked gross, but the wife went for it anyway.  I stuck with a King Kong burger, which is 1/2 pound of meat.  Had fried zucchini too.  Ate in our room.  Surprised - it wasn't that bad.  Not great by any stretch, but reminded me of drive-in food.  The gyro ended up tasting way better than the burger.  French fries are double-cooked so very tasty.
Lucas H.

To be honest, I was expecting to give this place about 1 to 2 stars. I'm not exactly sure how they stay in business, because they're overpriced, the pictures of food look disgusting and the place seems pretty rundown. It must be because of the food. I got a gyro plate for $10 and was surprisingly impressed. The Gyro was good and the fries were excellent. If they were able to consistently produce this quality, I would come back.
John S.
Had the gyro and fries, was not disappointed. The gyro was huge and I trashed it extremely quickly. Would go again!
Don M.

I am a fan of King Kong.  The gyro's are not the best in town and they tend to have slightly less meat than some of the other places, but you can always pay extra to get double meat.  They still taste good.   Their burgers are outstanding and you can build them as big as you want.   Personally I am a big fan of their fries which I think are among the best in town, as well as their fried zuchini and fried mushrooms.   I will say that I ordered their steak one time and it was chewy and fatty and took forever to eat it.  It was like eating an old boot.  So stay away from their steaks, but everything else is great.
Sarah J.
Love this place every time I eat here the food is fresh,testyThe manger is so nice he care about every single customer. I love the food this place is the best.
Lucy C.

we have been travelling from Chicago to Colorado and I have to say this is the WORST place we have stopped on the entire drive. staff was unhelpful and unfriendly. my husband ordered the food in English, the guy at the counter was a native Spanish speaker so my mom tried to talk to him in Spanish. he ignored her and continued speaking to my husband in English. we tried to order 3 Ault meals and 2 kids meals, which if you are not a child they will not sell you a drink on the same order...we got 5 kids meals and no drinks. so we bought 3 drinks separately for 7 dollars plus over 30 dollars we had spent on kids meals. basically we got 5 frozen food meals for 40 dollars. should have gone across the street to McDonald's.
Cheryl H.

Stopped at Lincoln overnight and chose King Kong for Mediterranean food.  The Greek salad with grilled chicken was fabulous----crisp, fresh, yummy dressing.  The chicken was perfectly cooked.  The gyro plate with chicken and potatoes was a delicious blend of hot and savory with cool and crunchy.  The pita was tender.  The Baklava was okay!  It's fun inside, if a little loud.
Breann C.

This place was a nice departure from the regular fast food joints you find on a road trip. We read another review and decided to go for it. We both got the chicken gyro- which had a ton of tasty grilled chicken. It was super filling and made fresh when we ordered. We passed on anything fried and each got a side salad. The salad was a pre-mixed Greek salad of iceberg lettuce, bell peppers, onion, and tomato. There was feta too and it was dressed with a vinegar dressing. It actually had a little bit of spice to it and wasn't bad, however the portions were kind of random (not tomatoes in one and lots of peppers in the other- you get what you get).We will likely stop here again on our next crossing of Neb. Yehaw!
Renee W.

MMMMMM This place is great!  The burgers are HUGE.  My fiance ordered a double something and he actually couldn't even finish it.  He normally eats 2 Whopper meals and is still hungry!!!!  I love the Gyro and the breaded zucchini.  If you ask for it you can get Gyro sauce for your zucchini instead of ranch...yum yum.Inside is sort of....well, it looks like a stuffed animal factory puked inside a McDonalds, but don't make your opinions based on that or you will truly be missing out!  Plus, kids love the stuffed animals ha ha. The staff is friendly and you can usually see the owners there (at least I think they are), and they are sweet in their own quirky way...some people may take offense to it, but I find nothing offensive about them at all...they just love to have fun and get to know people.A SPECIAL WARNING: most of the food is too big and messy to try to eat in the car, even while parked...i'm serious about this......I've tried several times, it just doesn't work out.
Adam H.

On our way back to Colorado from the East on I-80 when we wanted something to eat. We saw the Gorillas and decided to investigate further. After checking in with our trusty yelp reviews we decided it was worth the risk. The gamble paid off big time! I had the Friday special which was a gyro with fries they were beyond amazing. My wife had what seemed to be the biggest Greek salad in history; my daughter had the chicken tenders. I will say that was the BEST gyro I have ever had and my wife loved the salad, we thought it would have been more expensive than it was, but it was no more expensive than Wendy's or Arby's (both in the same vicinity). I liked the place so much I pleaded with owner to open one In Fort Collins, Colorado, he declined. Bottom line is, try it, you will like it! I really believe this place is the only reason people remain living in Nebraska.
Jasmine M.

On a long cross country drive from Maryland to Denver, Colorado, this was a nice pleasant road trip surprise! I was getting tired of the same old fast food, but I saw this huge King Kong sign from the highway and knew I had to check the place out.So how was it? Oen of the best gyros I had in quite some time! Not only was the food good, but the customer service was chill. The kid behind the counter was really nice and the entire atmosphere of the place has King Kong vintage posters, stuffed animals, and everything is basically King Kong themed. I even blogged about it!Worth checking out, especially if you happen to find yourself passing through Lincoln, Nebraska.
Mick B.
A double Kong burger and fries is a hangover's widowmaker. King Kong is so trusting of the locals that they have chained down their giant gorilla statues. Who doesn't want a 400 lb ape in their lawn?
Derek S.

Not a bad place. The gyro and fries are pretty good. Also had good reviews about the Kong burger. A little pricey, but the size makes up for it.  If you like gorillas, then this is the place for you! They really took this theme and ran with it. There is even an electronic gorilla band.
Jake O.

I'm a youth pastor from Iowa; a few weeks ago I was taking my teens to Nebraska for a youth rally, and we decided to stop at King Kong for lunch. First of all, there was a somewhat older woman who seemed to be in charge, and rude does not begin to describe her behavior. One of the young men in my group is from inner-city Texas originally, and was dressed exactly like it. She began taking our orders by asking me where we were from and why people dressed like that in Iowa. She made several other derogatory remarks about him, and was generally rude to us the whole time, interrupting our prayer and then sitting right next to us to keep an eye on my young friend.Now to clarify, the teen I brought did eventually strike back, which I do NOT condone, and I have had many conversations with him about it. He went and got a water cup and filled it with lemonade, and didn't pay. I began to offer to pay, but before I could, the woman kicked our entire youth group out, and made a show of trying to humiliate the young man from our group. As I said, I strongly discourage his behavior, but I had every intention of paying for him, and even tried explaining to her that I was a minister, but she was dead set on kicking this young man out long before he ever did anything.In short? This is the worst service I've ever experienced in my life, at any level of food. I've had my food dropped on the floor at a dirty KFC, and I'd go back there before I'd return to King Kong burger.Service aside, one of my teens pointed out that the food is served in comically large portions, to the point where no one finished their burger, even the hungriest of us.I wouldn't say don't eat here, but I recommend you know what kind of people they employ here, and do your best to look like a white, middle aged male.
Mike M.

First time here and I got the gyro, fries drink special. It was $9.60 with tax. The staff was friendly and the food was served quick.  I like a gyro and order them often when traveling. The gyro was big but bland. Very little flavor. A big portion of fries but they're frozen and again little flavor. Hey, the diet pepsi was good.  Overall it was a mediocre meal.  From what I experienced and looking at previous reviews they give  you a lot of food but the prices reflect it so there is no deal there.  It was like I went to McDonalds and supersized it.   Filled me up but nothing special.
John G.

Took the fam with a Groupon for lunch. 1st visit. Cost over $20 AFTER the $10 Groupon for 2 adults and 2 kids. Big portions. Tasted ok, but not great. 2 employees were gawking at my wife. Completely unacceptable... Been burping gyro for 4 hours. I'll never go there again.
Lesley W.
Best gyro I've had in a very long time! Well worth the money.
Marisa V.

All I can say is, do not judge this place by the way it looks outside. Decoration is a bit cheezy but the food is awesome. I had the grilled chicken salad and it was superb. The chicken was well marinated and grilled..yummy! My hubby had the gyro and fries. Yummy.. :) Fries were so good. I thought about taking food home but it would probably smell the car up..I will definitely go back next time we are in Lincoln. :)
Alexandra B.

first thing: this place does NOT serve chinese! it's fast food.Heard great things about this place from a friend, and decided to stop in for quick dinner on our way from Colorado to Illinois. Super convenienty located off the highway. It was pretty busy when we got there! I hear their gyros are great, but I got a 1/2 lb King Kong cheeseburger with cheese fries - burger was big, but just okay. Great cheese fries! My friend said the gyros in Chicago are better...can't say I'm surprised though! How many authetic Greeks can there possibly be in the middle of nowhere, Nebraska? Surprisingly though, the sirloin steak looked amazing. For fast food, it's pretty good and the outside/inside decor is pretty cool - gorillas everywhere :) Stop in if ever driving through!
Rob S.

I decided to try this restaurant simply because of the big King Kong on the top of the restaurant.  What I found was a place with an interesting variety.  They have some very large burgers starting at 1/2 pound.  I chose the Super King Kong - 2 lbs of beef.  I figured, why not?  I was not able to finish the whole thing (I did choke down 3/4 of it.)  It was one of the best burgers I've had.  Good charcoal taste.  Highly recommend it, but bring your appetite.
Hj V.
Possibly the best thing about Nebraska!!! We had the BEST gyro salad I have ever eaten!!! This place is goofy looking, but the Greek food here is fabulous.
matt a.

was working in Lincoln and decided to give the place a try.i like to try new places while traveling.the woman at the register was a bitch i guess.but that said the food was excellent and large portions for ten bucks.i had the chicken gyro plate.huge.get the greek potatoes they are incredible.i would not go if you are trying to drive and eat.
Sinbad's Restaurant: We wanted to try a new restaurant tonight and found Sinbads on Yelp.  The reviews looked promising.  We were not disappointed!  We tried a combination platter so we could have a taste of many things.  They were all wonderful!  Loved the lentil soup, the chicken kebab and the biryani, but the falafel really stood out to me.  I had never tasted one I liked before.  Can't wait to go back!

Doesn't get more authentic than people yelling across the restaurant in Arabic.Seriously though, my meal was so yummy. I started with the hummus, which had a little spiciness to it--different but good! I had the Sambosa for my main meal, also tasty. However, I made the mistake of filling up on pita and hummus, so I had to take most of my entree home. I don't mind enjoying it again though :)Lincoln has a lot of hidden, local places, and this is one. I hope to come back!

Great restaurant,  good food,  nice people and fast service. Ordered the lamb and it was pretty good. The okra soup was not too but a little soggy.  The lamb came on a bed of rice and with a full piece of pita bread. The bread itself was homemade and you can tell by the taste and texture of the bread itself.   It's more of a local neighborhood joint. I can't be too excited about the place or return because I was ripped off. The lamb entree was $11.99 and it came with a soup.  I still can't figure out how the final bill came to $15 and some change.  Even with tax I can't see paying more than $13.

The price is a little expensive, but I liked the combo kabab at $16.99. I took out as lot of food to eat in. The waitress is friendly and was showing a smiling face. That's very important for me. Good place to stop by . management should reduce the price to bring in more customers.
Good authentic middle eastern.  The combination beef chicken lamb Kabob plate was well done and plenty for dinner.
This place is great.  Everything on the menu is fresh and amazing...this is a place worth going to time and time again...inside is very friendly, quaint and clean!! Do yourself a flavor and stop by!!

A hidden gem for Greek and Middle Eastern food lovers! The outside is rather unassuming, but don't let that fool you. The inside is pretty clean, and the food is good and inexpensive for the portions you get.I got the small (lunch-sized) lamb gyro, which was actually a pretty filling meal. Just know that it's served as a meat dish, with the pita bread (two nice, fluffy pieces) is served separate. The lamb was delicious, easily competition for The Sultan's Kite. The cool thing too is they serve a free cup of Iraqi tea with each order! For dessert I asked for baklava, and the guy showed me their three different styles of "baklava." Now I put that in quotes not because it wasn't totally delicious, but because two of their styles were ones I'd never seen before. One resembled small cannoli, and the other, which I got, kinda looked like funnel cake. It was made of intertwined, clear pieces of hardened dough, and covered in clear honey. It was freaking succulent.And the prices were great! For all that plus tip, I didn't shell out more than 12 bucks, for a filling lunch. Totally recommend this place.
The food is average. The cook is always siting outside smoking cigarette. There side dishes are ok the main dish is not so good.

I am definitely a regular here. In my opinion this is the best Middle Eastern/Mediterranean restaurant out of both Lincoln and Omaha. It is Iraqi styled and they have amazing kafta kabobs, chicken kabobs are tender and not dry, beef kabobs also tender and very flavorful. Plus you can help yourself to free tea. Service is great, owner is awesome, food is delicious. I started out just getting the Kafta Kabobs when i would go there but changed my order to the small combo which includes kafta, chicken, beef kabobs along with Iraqi style bread, salad, and a sambosa, along with a tasty garlic dipping sauce or dressing... very filling, but incredibly delicious. Closest Kafta to the ones I had actually gotten in Iraq. Hummus is very good too, but i don't order it much considering the Small Combo more than fills me up.

I can't say enough about this restaurant!!! From the outside it looks a little run down, but inside it is clean, cozy, and quite. A great spot for a cute couple or a hungry group, the combo plates are super great to share. The rice kubbah is amazing, and you HAVE to try the hummus! Free tea and super fast service. I don't know why this place is always so dead, the food is amazing!!! Don't be afraid to poke your head in the kitchen if no one is around or just grab a menu and sit down.  After two visits I feel right at home here! The servers don't go out of their way to bother you during your meal so make sure to let them know if you need something. Personally I like to be left to enjoy my meal without a waiter trying to shove a check down my throat and rush me out the door. I always feel welcome at Sinbad's!Also they no longer use styrofoam plates! I saw previous reviews mentioning this but I think Sinbad's has stepped up their game since then. I thought the serving size was fair, I always leave fat and happy.

Cute place with kitschy paintings, grilled meats and Russia Today on TV. Had the mixed grill plate: the chicken was especially good, salad left something to be desired. Seems like the place to be on a Sunday night if you're an Iraqi man in want of like company. No booze, obviously. Order at the table, pay at the register.
I believe this resturant is the best  middle east restaurant in lincoln.

Great food at great prices! They've upped the prices recently, but I think the food is still worth it. It does look a tad dive-y from the outside but don't let that bother you. I usually order the beef teka, shawarma, gyros, or beef kabob with rice, and usually have enough for leftovers. The garlic/yogurt sauce they give you is very tasty and although they only give you small portions of it, a little goes a long way. The free Iraqi tea is great. Next on the list to try is their lamb!
My favorite place in Lincoln. Best garlic sauce ever! And the eggplant soup is killer.

Alright, Sinbads...you've won the five stars.  I love this place.  Within around a 6 month period you have recently become one of my favorite places here in Lincoln.I think what I love about this place is that they change things up, and the same dish will have different spices and blends to it every time I order it.  This may be off putting for some, but for me it's wonderful.  I love trying the meats and rice and being wowed with different tastes and sensations every single time.  The hummus is the best I've ever had, and the Iraqi bread served with it is excellent.  Go to Sinbad's....NOW.

I would recommend giving this place a try if you like mild middle eastern food. The service was great, the food was good and fresh, the presentation was well , and the prices were right.  I ordered the chicken teka kabob plate which comes with soup, salad , rice and chicken breasts that are slowly charbroiled.  I also ordered pockets stuffed with meat and spices... and the garlic yogurt sauce is Soooo good for dipping.   This is not a fancy place, but well worth trying. They take visa as well.

This place is pretty divey, but the food is solid and tasty.  They make these middle eastern eggroll type things that are FAB!!!!  And I could eat their hummus by the gallon.  I like the chicken tekka quite a bit.  And I love the fattoush!  But, the soups aren't very tasty at all.  And if you've got a Middle Eastern food jones in the summer, be sure to call in a take out order.  I'm not sure they run the AC, and it's hot as hell in there.  But during winter, it's just fine.  The staff always gives good service, and lavishes attention on my baby girl.

I love this place. Every dish I have had has been delicious. I love the combo platters. You get a bunch of different types of their meat dishes, flafel, a heaping plate of wonderful rice, fresh salad, and a choice of one of many great soups. The service is top notch and super friendly. This place blows all other mediterranean places out of the water in Lincoln. Cheap and delicious!

Invited to sit down, given menus, and water.  The food arrived promptly but the portions didn't look like the photos.  I didn't like the styrofoam plate it came on. Don't think I'll be going back.  Prices didn't really justify the amount on the plates
Awful! The chicken is dry, soup taste like shit, they even messed the rice up. How do u mess up rice? On top of that it smelled like i was inside a huge asshole.

I've visited many restaurants all over that US that offer Mediterranean/Middle Eastern food but I always end up coming back to Sinbad's.  I have been going there for years and it has yet to disappoint.  A sure bet every time, especially for a first timer, is the Small Combo which includes generous portions of chicken and beef teka, a perfectly seasoned beef kabob, and kubba.  And of course they include plenty of bread and rice.  I also always get their bean soup which pairs perfectly with the chicken teka, bread and rice.  Be sure to finish with the hot Iraqi tea (add lots of sugar).  I love this place!

Camerons makin stuff of.  They have decent food.  I occasionally get for take out.  Atmosphere is kinda  of iffy but food is decent.  Its not gourmet but have yet to find gourmet mediterranean/middle eastern food anywhere in the world.    Its a good joint, give it a try for take out, for sure.
